title: How to Remove a Notion Teamspace from Your Workspace: 2 Easy Ways

steps.title: Locate the teamspace you want to archive.
steps.content: Locate the teamspace you want to archive. Notion teamspaces cannot be completely deleted, but you can archive them to remove them from your sidebar to reduce unnecessary clutter. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click on the teamspace name.
steps.content: Right-click on the teamspace name. If you're on Mac, you can Ctrl + click.

steps.title: Click Archive teamspace.
steps.content: Click Archive teamspace . It's the last option on the list.

steps.title: Type the name of the teamspace and click Archive teamspace.
steps.content: Type the name of the teamspace and click Archive teamspace . Notion will ask if you want to move your teamspace pages to the Private and Shared sections of your sidebar. You can opt to move these pages or proceed without moving them. To find your archived teamspace, go to Settings & members > Teamspaces . Change the Archived dropdown from "active" to "archived" to view your archived teamspaces. You can unarchive them by clicking the three-dot button to the right and selecting Restore teamspace . Note that you must be in an active teamspace for the Teamspace option to be present in your settings.

steps.title: Right-click the desired teamspace.
steps.content: Right-click the desired teamspace. If you're on Mac, you can Ctrl + click. If you aren't the owner of a teamspace, or there are multiple owners, you can leave the teamspace entirely to remove it from your sidebar. This won't delete it, but you won't have it in your Notion anymore.

steps.title: Select Leave teamspace.
steps.content: Select Leave teamspace . The button has a waving hand icon and is above Archive teamspace . If you want to get back into the teamspace, you must be invited again by one of the teamspace owners. Note that some teamspaces are set up to not allow users to leave. If this is the case, you will have to contact the teamspace owner to be removed.
